NAEB TAPE NETWORK
August 21, 195>1
leport to Messrs# Hudson, Schramm, and Siegel
Topic: The Fall Programming
Stations Participating in the network
In June of 19>1, the stations participating in the NAEB Tape Network
numbered 1*2 o These 1*2 stations were divided into four geographic legs0
Now the nmber of Network stations has risen to 71« (It might be 72
tomorrow if confirmation of KUQW, Seattle, comes iiio) These stations
have been divided into eight legs# Enclosed is a list of stations as
divided into geographic legs#
Programs
The Network is offering this Fall 10 series of programs, most of which
are 13 weeks long# In addition to these 10, two extras are being
offered# These extras are of either one or two programs#each#

In addition to scheduling these seriesi Network headquarters furnished
promotion material to the stations to aid them in publicizing the programs
Enclosed you will find copies of this material along with program lists#
Breakdown
The above series have been broken up into two packages. The new package
system will be explained later. Series £1-7 to £l-lh inclusive are
included in Package ,/l0 This package will supply five hours of program¬
ming per week. The remainder of the series and the two extras are
included in Package #2. This package will supply 2 hours of programming
per week#
